etymology.description: 至(至) (zhì, "to arrive") + 刀(刀) (dāo, "knife") = semantic 'to arrive' + phonetic value -> to
etymology.interpretation: The character 到(dào) combines the meaning of arriving from 至(至) (zhì, "to arrive") with the sound component from 刀(刀) (dāo, "knife") to represent the concept of reaching a destination.

examples.chinese: 我们到学校后(我們到學校後)，开始上课(開始上課)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen dào xuéxiào hòu, kāishǐ shàngkè.
examples.english: We arrived at school, and then started class.

examples.chinese: 火车到站时(火車到站時)，旅客纷纷下车(旅客紛紛下車)。
examples.pinyin: Huǒchē dào zhàn shí, lǚkè fēnfēn xià chē.
examples.english: When the train arrived at the station, the passengers got off one after another.
